items.title: Good things happening as Daniel Jones once again paired with elite RB (Jonathan Taylor)
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – It’s been just two games, but the cause and effect is undeniable. Give Daniel Jones a viable and vibrant run game, and all things are possible. “It makes a tremendous impact, a running back like that who can hit the big one, hit the home run, who can make it happen late in [...]

items.title: How Colts QB Daniel Jones is handling near-historic level of blitzes to begin 2025 season
items.summary: Jones has been blitzed on 50 dropbacks over his first two games, per Pro Football Focus, which isn't just the highest total in the NFL this season – it's the highest total to begin a season in over a decade.

items.title: 'What it's all about:' Colts players attend fourth annual Colts Unified Flag Classic
items.summary: On Tuesday, the Colts hosted the fourth annual Colts Unified Flag Classic in partnership with Special Olympics Indiana and the Indiana High School Athletic Association.

items.title: Colts’ Jonathan Taylor AFC Offensive Player of the Week
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Jonathan Taylor’s latest breakout game caught the attention of the league office. The Indianapolis Colts’ veteran running back has been named AFC Offensive Player of the Week on the strength of his performance in Sunday’s 29-28 win over Denver. Taylor rushed 25 times for 165 yards and added 50 yards and a touchdown [...]

items.title: Colts RB Jonathan Taylor named AFC Offensive Player of the Week for Week 2
items.summary: Taylor had 25 carries for 165 yards, and two receptions for 50 yards and a touchdown in the Colts' win over the Denver Broncos.

items.title: 'It's a violent play': Why the rest of the NFL isn't using the tush push
items.summary: The Eagles have converted the tush push 96.6% of the time on fourth-and-1, so why don't all teams use it? Here's why.

items.title: Colts’ Week 2 QB Analysis: Is this real life?

items.title: Would getting Colts’ QB Anthony Richardson involved be a mistake?

items.title: Why Colts, Shane Steichen had confidence in Spencer Shrader to make 60-yard field goal vs. Broncos
items.summary: Shrader missed his 60-yard field goal attempt on Sunday, but not because he didn't have the strength to get the ball through the uprights.

items.title: Colts announce promotion of linebacker to active roster and signing of center to practice squad
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts announced on Tuesday the promotion of linebacker Austin Ajiake from their practice squad and the subsequent signing of center Jimmy Morrissey to replace him therein. Having signed with the Colts back in 2023, Ajiake has remained within the Indianapolis organization. He was released as part of initial 53-man roster cuts this past […]

items.title: Colts worked out a wealth of cornerbacks on Monday
items.summary: According to the NFL official transaction wire, the Indianapolis Colts worked out a wealth of cornerbacks on Monday, including Isaiah Bolden, Tre Flowers, Keenan Garber, Daequan Hardy, Kennan Isaac, and Nik Needham. The Colts also worked out center Jimmy Morrissey. Among the biggest names on the list are Isaiah Bolden, Nik Needham, and former Colts […]

items.summary: Colts start 2-0 We can sit here and dissect all we want, and it is certainly entertaining, but in the end all that matters is that the Colts are 2-0, and for the first time in over 15 years. I consider myself an optimistic person, and I was not expecting a start like this at […]

items.title: Colts’ Shane Steichen: Should have been more aggressive on game-winning field goal drive
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Shane Steichen offered a mea culpa, and those are always easier to deal with after what transpired Sunday at Lucas Oil Stadium. Less than 24 hours after his Indianapolis Colts chased down Denver 29-28 as time expired on Spencer Shrader’s 45-yard field goal, Steichen conceded he made things more difficult than they needed [...]

items.title: Colts’ Monday Morning Awards: Week 2 vs. Broncos
items.summary: 2-0 for the first time since 2009, and the Colts continue with their surprises. Andrew Luck could not do it in his entire career, and Daniel Jones has managed to do it in his first season in blue. I was not optimistic at all about the outlook for this year, but after just two games, […]

items.title: Colts Blue Zone Podcast 424: Colts Top Broncos on Second-Chance Kick
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts topped the Denver Broncos to open a season 2-0 for the first time since 2009. Thanks to another standout game from Daniel Jones and a strong performance from Jonathan Taylor (plus some mistakes from Denver), Indy gutted out the 29-28 win on a last-second kick from Spencer Shrader. Matt Adams looks at [...]

items.title: Colts got a thrilling win, but need better from Shane Steichen
items.summary: Woah, nelly! The Colts-Broncos game scored at least an 8/10 on the thrill meter as the back and forth affair ended in dramatic fashion. The Indianapolis Colts lost on a 60-yard miss from Spencer Shrader only to be resurrected and given new life on a personal foul call that gave them 15-yards and an untimed […]

items.title: Daniel Jones, I Owe You An Apology; I Wasn’t Familiar With Your Game
items.summary: Indianapolis, IN — As pandemonium ensued following the initially missed game-winning kick off the foot of kicker Spencer Shrader, Shane Steichen sighed loud enough for the nosebleeds to hear it. The third-year head coach had just led his offense down the field, trailing by two points amidst a 2-minute drill, and elected to passively chew […]

items.title: Colts-Titans opening odds: First road test for the Colts awaits
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts started the NFL season at home gaining wins against the Dolphins and Broncos. Not only is it their first road game, it also marks the first divisional opponent in the Tennessee Titans. The Titans are a team the Colts know well, but with a new rookie quarterback in first overall pick Cam […]

items.title: Colts' receivers don't back down against Broncos' CB Pat Surtain II, deliver key plays against 2024 Defensive Player of the Year in Week 2 win
items.summary: In throwing for 316 yards in the Colts' 29-28 win over the Denver Broncos in Week 2, quarterback Daniel Jones consistently trusted his pass-catchers against 2024 AP Defensive Player of the Year Pat Surtain II.

items.title: Colts, Spencer Shrader make best of difficult situation; Indy 2-0
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — Spencer Shrader was preparing for the toughest kick of his young NFL life. And Shane Steichen seemed intent on making it as difficult as possible. With time winding down Sunday at a raucous Lucas Oil Stadium, the Indianapolis Colts trailed Denver, 28-26. But they were driving. First-and-10 at the Broncos’ 43-yard line, one [...]

items.title: Daniel Jones, Colts' offense pass major test with efficient, explosive showing in win over stingy Broncos defense
items.summary: Daniel Jones completed 23 of 34 passes for 316 yards with a passing and rushing touchdown in the Colts' 29-28 Week 2 win over the Denver Broncos on Sunday at Lucas Oil Stadium.

items.title: How faith and discipline set up Spencer Shrader's game-winning field goal: 'You just have to trust'
items.summary: Shrader nailed a 45-yard field goal – his fifth of the game – to secure the Colts' win over the Broncos on Sunday.

items.title: Shrader's kick propels Colts to 29-28 win and 2-0 start
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — Spencer Shrader kicked a 45-yard, game-winning field goal as time expired to lift the Indianapolis Colts to a 29-28 win over the Denver Broncos on Sunday afternoon. The Colts are now 2-0 for the first time since 2009. Shrader missed a 60-yard attempt before his 45-yarder, but the Broncos were flagged for leverage. [...]

items.title: Colts rally for comeback win vs. Broncos
items.summary: The Colts took down the Broncos 29-28 on a last-second field goal from Spencer Shrader.

items.title: Colts announce 6 inactive players for Week 2 game vs. Denver Broncos

items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS - The Colts are aiming to go 2-0 for the first time since 2009 when they host the Denver Broncos on Sunday afternoon. IndyStar Colts' insider Joel A. Erickson gives his keys to avenging a heartbreaking loss to the Broncos last season.

Spread: Broncos by 2½. History lesson, Part I  The Colts are in position for their first 2-0 start since 2009. They opened their run to Super Bowl XLIV with 14 straight victories. Peyton [...]

items.title: Colts place CB Jaylon Jones on IR
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — As expected, the Indianapolis Colts will be without Jaylon Jones for an extended time. The third-year cornerback was placed on the injured reserve list Saturday with a hamstring injury. That requires missing at least the next four games. Jones, a 2023 seventh-round draft pick, started 27 games in his first two seasons - [...]

items.title: Colts vs. Broncos preview: Shane Steichen, Daniel Jones face stiff challenge against Vance Joseph, Pat Surtain II and Denver defense

items.title: Practice notebook: Colts' cornerback depth comes into focus with Charvarius Ward Sr. in concussion protocol, Jaylon Jones out
items.summary: Neither Ward nor Jones practiced Thursday – head coach Shane Steichen said Jones would be out for a while – meaning the Colts may lean on three newcomers at corner to step in for Sunday's game against the Denver Broncos.

items.title: The Colts are leaning into versatility on offense in 2025 with a sneaky undercurrent to it
items.summary: In Week 1, seven Colts players caught a pass – but 17 of Daniel Jones' 29 targets went to tight end Tyler Warren and Michael Pittman Jr.

items.summary: The InSideOut Initiative, in partnership with the Indianapolis Colts, IHSAA Foundation and the NFL Foundation, is set to re-launch in Indiana on September 17

items.title: 9 years into NFL career, Kenny Moore II is still building his legacy
items.summary: Kenny Moore II, as a 16-year-old, quit football. He was coaxed back a day later. Over a decade later, he's still playing, and still has plenty more to accomplish.

items.title: Week 2 'White Out Game' coming to Lucas Oil Stadium
items.summary: Fans are encouraged to wear white Colts gear to the game to match the team’s on-field look and transform the stadium into a “White Out.”

items.title: Colts announce new 'Fall Fest' activities at two local farms
items.summary: Fall Fests will feature full days of fun, including corn mazes, pumpkin patches, hayrides, carnival rides, pony rides together with Colts giveaways, sweepstakes and appearances from team mascot “Blue” and the Colts Cheerleaders.

items.title: Colts TE Tyler Warren nominated for NFL Rookie of the Week for Week 1
items.summary: Warren had seven receptions for 76 yards in the Colts' 33-8 win over the Miami Dolphins on Sunday.
